subject: can't catch exceptions in test method
msgSnippet: I m trying to test a iPlanet AppLogic dependent class and am unable to catch an exception or even see that one is occuring. I was wondering if the way tests
messageBody:
I'm trying to test a iPlanet AppLogic dependent class
and am unable to "catch" an exception or even see that
one is occuring. I was wondering if the way tests are
run prevent some exceptions from being thrown?

Basically I have the following...

DataTest.java
-------------
public class DataTest extends TestCase {

private BaseAppLogic _appLogic = null;

public DataTest(String name) {
super(name);
System.out.println("new DataTest");
}

protected void setUp() {
_appLogic = new BaseAppLogic();
System.out.println(_appLogic);
}

public void testOne() {
try {
CityNames _cn = new CityNames(_appLogic);
String _s = _cn.test();
} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
return;
}
fail("Expected Exception");
}

public static Test suite() {

// add all tests to the suite
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(DataTest.class);
return suite;

}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new
TestSuite(DataTest.class));
}
}

CityNames.java
--------------
public class CityNames extends Object
{
public CityNames(BaseAppLogic appLogic)
{
m_AppLogic = appLogic;
}

public String getAllCitiesInfo() throws Exception
{
// code that probably throws an exception
;
}
}
